body.p:
State of Indiana
Couty of Clark } ss

Willis M. Hughes upon oath says that on the 18th day of August 1864 at Clark county state of Indiana William J. Roberts, did feloniously steal take and drive away one bay horse of the value of One hundred and thirty five dollars the property of the said Willis M. Hughes -- And affiant further says that after committing the felony above charged, to wit on the 19. day of August 1864 the said William J. Roberts fled from the state of Indiana to the county of Jefferson in the state of Kentucky where he now is, as affiant verily believes --
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 6th day of October 1864.

State of Indiana
Clark County } s. s. --

I Campbell Hay Clerk of the Circuit court, in and for said county, hereby certify that Joel M. Smith Esquire, before whom the foregoing affidavit was made, was at the time of the making therof, to wit on 6th day of October 1864, an
acting Justice of the Peace in and for said County duly Elected commissioned & Sworn, and that full faith & credit should be given to his official acts as such Justice and that the signature above purporting to be his is genuine.
Witness my hand and the seal of said Court, affixed at Charlestown this 6th day of October 1864
